rigel.clients package

Submodules

rigel.clients.docker module

class rigel.clients.docker.DockerClient[source]

Bases: object

A wrapper class for the docker.client.DockerClient. Keeps the same functionality but allows for error handling that suits better Rigel.

DOCKER_CONTAINER_ID_DISPLAY_SIZE: int = 12
DOCKER_RUN_TIMEOUT: int = 120
DOCKER_RUN_WAIT_STATUS: int = 3
client: DockerClient
create_builder(name: str, use: bool = True, driver: str = 'docker-container') → Builder[source]

Create a Docker builder.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – the builder name

  • use (bool, optional) – set to use, defaults to True

Returns:

the created Docker builder, if unexistent.

Return type:

python_on_whales.components.buildx.cli_wrapper.Builder

create_network(name: str, driver: str) → Network[source]

Create a Docker network.

Parameters:

  • driver (string) – Name of driver used to create the network.

Return type:

python_on_whales.components.network.cli_wrapper.Network

run_container(name: str, image: str, **kwargs: Any) → Container | str | Iterable[Tuple[str, bytes]][source]

Run a Docker container with a given name.

wait_for_container_status(name: str, status: str) → None[source]

Wait for a container status to change to a desired value.

Parameters:

  • name (string) – The name of the container to watch.

  • status (string) – The desires container status.

rigel.clients.rosbridge module

class rigel.clients.rosbridge.ROSBridgeClient(host: str = 'localhost', port: int = 9090, retries=15)[source]

Bases: object

A client for the ROS bridge websocket server that supports multiple handler functions for a same ROS event. This is essentialy a wrapper class around the roslibpy.ros.Ros class.

Parameters:

  • handlers (Dict[ROS_EVENT_TYPE, List[rigel.clients.rosbridge.ROS_EVENT_HANDLER_TYPE]]) – A map between ROS events and their handlers

  • subscribers (Dict[ROS_EVENT_TYPE, roslibpy.core.Topic]) – A map between ROS events and their subscribers

close() → None[source]

Close connection between to the ROS bridge websocket server.

handlers: Dict[Tuple[str, str], List[Callable[[Dict[str, Any]], None]]]
register_message_handler(topic: str, message_type: str, handler: Callable[[Dict[str, Any]], None]) → None[source]

Registers a ROS message handler and starts listening for incoming messages.

Parameters:

  • topic (str) – The ROS topic to subscribe.

  • message_type (str) – The expected ROS message type.

  • handler (ROS_EVENT_HANDLER_TYPE) – The message handler function to be executed everytime

a message is received.

remove_message_handler(topic: str, message_type: str, handler: Callable[[Dict[str, Any]], None]) → None[source]

Deletes a registered ROS message handler and stops forwarding ROS messages arriving on specified topic.

Parameters:

  • topic (str) – The ROS topic associated with the message handler.

  • message_type (str) – The type of ROS messages associated with the message handler.

  • handler (ROS_EVENT_HANDLER_TYPE) – The message handler function to be removed.

subscribers: Dict[Tuple[str, str], Topic]
